author: metachris_
content: If the relays would only send the header to the single upcoming proposer, then builders wouldn't be aware of each others bids, and it would actually be a sealed auction. Whereas in the current API proposal, anyone could query any relay about the current best bid.

author: jgm
content:
Signing things takes time.  I'm not a fan of adding additional complexity in to the process unless there is a real requirement.  Having read through the linked issues, I'm not sure I see the requirement.

The idea that this would result in some sort of builder auction can be solved pretty easily: builders need to bid a fair amount to begin with.  Having a single-shot bid for a given block by a builder would avoid a lot of additional back-and-forth that would be likely to happen otherwise.

The comment in 102 by <@543900561460822016> regarding the ability to detect relays witholding blocks doesn't seem to need item i) because its presence is a requirement for item ii) to be seen.
